pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:0.5.eng: The training rule on one year

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo ekaṃ vassaṃ dve vuṭṭhāpenti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:1.2.eng: At that time the nuns were giving the full admission to two women per year,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:1.3.eng: and the nuns’ dwelling place still did not have sufficient capacity.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo ekaṃ vassaṃ dve vuṭṭhāpessanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:1.5.eng: “How can the nuns give the full admission to two women per year,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:1.6.eng: when the nuns’ dwelling place still doesn’t have sufficient capacity?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:1.7.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:1.7.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:1.8.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:1.8.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:1.9.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo ekaṃ vassaṃ dve vuṭṭhāpessantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:1.9.eng: “How can nuns give the full admission to two women per year?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:1.10.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo ekaṃ vassaṃ dve vuṭṭhāpentī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:1.10.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:1.13.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo ekaṃ vassaṃ dve vuṭṭhāpessanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:1.15.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:1.15.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:1.16.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī ekaṃ vassaṃ dve vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:1.16.1.eng: ‘If a nun gives the full admission to two women in one year, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:2.1.7.eng: Gives the full admission to two women:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:2.1.8.eng: gives the full ordination to two women.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:2.1.9.pli: “Dve vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti gaṇaṃ vā ācariniṃ vā pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā pariyesati, sīmaṃ vā sammannati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:2.1.9.eng: If, intending to give the full admission to two women, she searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or she establishes a monastery zone, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:2.1.10.eng: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:2.1.10.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at Bu Ss 10:2.65, the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that in these contexts dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:2.1.11.eng: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:2.1.12.eng: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:2.1.13.pli: Gaṇassa ca ācariniyā ca āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:2.1.13.eng: and the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:2.2.2.eng: if she gives the full admission to one woman every other year;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:2.2.4.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:2.2.5.eng: The thirteenth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc83:2.2.6.eng: The eighth subchapter on unmarried girls is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:0.4.eng: The subchapter on sunshades and sandals

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:0.5.eng: The training rule on sunshades and sandals

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo chattupāhanaṃ dhārenti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.2.eng: the nuns from the group of six used sunshades and sandals.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo chattupāhanaṃ dhāressanti, seyyathāpi gihiniyo kāmabhoginiyo”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.4.eng: “How can nuns use sunshades and sandals? They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.5.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.6.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.7.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six use sunshades and sandals?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo chattupāhanaṃ dhārentī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo chattupāhanaṃ dhāressanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.11.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.14.1.eng: ‘If a nun uses a sunshade and sandals, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.15.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhunīnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.1.15.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā bhikkhunī gilānā hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.2.1.eng: Soon afterwards there was a sick nun

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.2.2.pli: Tassā vinā chattupāhanaṃ na phāsu hoti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.2.2.eng: who was not comfortable without sandals and a sunshade. …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.2.3.eng: They told the Buddha. The Buddha then had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.2.4.eng: “Monks, I allow a sick nun to use a sunshade and sandals.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.2.5.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.2.5.eng: And so, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.2.6.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī agilānā chattupāhanaṃ dhāreyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:1.2.6.1.eng: ‘If a nun who is not sick uses a sunshade and sandals, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.1.6.eng: who is comfortable without a sunshade and sandals.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.1.8.pli: yassā vinā chattupāhanaṃ na phāsu hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.1.8.eng: who is not comfortable without a sunshade and sandals.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.1.10.pli: tīṇi chattāni— setacchattaṃ, kilañjacchattaṃ, paṇṇacchattaṃ maṇḍalabaddhaṃ salākabaddhaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.1.10.eng: there are three kinds of sunshades: the white sunshade, the reed sunshade, the leaf sunshade. They are bound at the rim and bound at the ribs.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.1.10.comm: Sp 2.634: Maṇḍalabaddhaṁ salākabaddhanti idaṁ pana tiṇṇampi chattānaṁ pañjaradassanatthaṁ vuttaṁ. Tāni hi maṇḍalabaddhāni ceva honti salākabaddhāni ca. “Maṇḍalabaddhaṁ salākabaddhan: this is said for the purpose of showing the frame of the three sunshades. For they are bound at the rim (maṇḍalabaddha) and bound at the ribs (salākabaddha).”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.1.12.eng: if she uses them even once, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.2.1.pli: Agilānā agilānasaññā chattupāhanaṃ dhāreti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.2.1.eng: If she is not sick, and she does not perceive herself as sick, and she uses a sunshade and sandals, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.2.2.pli: Agilānā vematikā chattupāhanaṃ dhāreti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.2.2.eng: If she is not sick, but she is unsure of it, and she uses a sunshade and sandals, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.2.3.pli: Agilānā gilānasaññā chattupāhanaṃ dhāreti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.2.3.eng: If she is not sick, but she perceives herself as sick, and she uses a sunshade and sandals, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.2.4.pli: Chattaṃ dhāreti na upāhanaṃ, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.2.4.eng: If she uses a sunshade, but not sandals, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.2.5.pli: Upāhanaṃ dhāreti na chattaṃ, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.2.5.eng: If she uses sandals, but not a sunshade, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.2.6.eng: If she is sick, but she does not perceive herself as sick, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.2.7.eng: If she is sick, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.2.8.eng: If she is sick, and she perceives herself as sick, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.3.3.eng: if she uses them in a monastery or in the vicinity of a monastery;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.3.6.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc84:2.3.7.eng: The first training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:0.4.eng: The subchapter on sunshades and sandals

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo yānena yāyanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.1.2.eng: the nuns from the group of six were traveling in vehicles.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo yānena yāyissanti, seyyathāpi gihiniyo kāmabhoginiyo”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.1.4.eng: “How can the nuns travel in a vehicle? They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.1.5.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.1.6.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.1.7.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six travel in a vehicle?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo yānena yāyantī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo yānena yāyissanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.1.11.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.1.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.1.14.1.eng: ‘If a nun travels in a vehicle, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.1.15.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhunīnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.1.15.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā bhikkhunī gilānā hoti, na sakkoti padasā gantuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.2.1.eng: Soon afterwards there was a sick nun who was not able to travel on foot. …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.2.2.eng: They told the Buddha. The Buddha then had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.2.3.eng: “Monks, I allow a sick nun to use a vehicle.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.2.4.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.2.4.eng: And so, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.2.5.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī agilānā yānena yāyeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:1.2.5.1.eng: ‘If a nun who is not sick travels in a vehicle, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:2.1.6.eng: who is able to travel on foot.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:2.1.8.eng: who is unable to travel on foot.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:2.1.10.pli: vayhaṃ ratho sakaṭaṃ sandamānikā sivikā pāṭaṅkī.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:2.1.10.eng: a wagon, a carriage, a cart, a chariot, a palanquin, a litter.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:2.1.12.eng: if she travels in a vehicle even once, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:2.2.1.pli: Agilānā agilānasaññā yānena yāyati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:2.2.1.eng: If she is not sick, and she does not perceive herself as sick, and she travels in a vehicle, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:2.2.2.pli: Agilānā vematikā yānena yāyati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:2.2.2.eng: If she is not sick, but she is unsure of it, and she travels in a vehicle, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:2.2.3.pli: Agilānā gilānasaññā yānena yāyati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:2.2.3.eng: If she is not sick, but she perceives herself as sick, and she travels in a vehicle, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:2.2.4.eng: If she is sick, but she does not perceive herself as sick, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:2.2.5.eng: If she is sick, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:2.2.6.eng: If she is sick, and she perceives herself as sick, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:2.3.5.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc85:2.3.6.eng: The second training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:0.4.eng: The subchapter on sunshades and sandals

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:0.5.eng: The training rule on ornamentations of the hip

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā bhikkhunī aññatarissā itthiyā kulūpikā hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.2.eng: there was a nun was associating with the family of a certain woman.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.3.pli: Atha kho sā itthī taṃ bhikkhuniṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.3.eng: That woman said to that nun,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.4.pli: “handāyye, imaṃ saṅghāṇiṃ amukāya nāma itthiyā dehī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.4.eng: “Venerable, please give this hip ornament to such-and-such a woman.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.6.pli: “sacāhaṃ pattena ādāya gacchāmi vissaro me bhavissatī”ti paṭimuñcitvā agamāsi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.6.eng: “If I carry it in my almsbowl, I’ll get into trouble,” and so she put it on and then left.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.7.eng: While she was walking along a street the threads snapped and were scattered all over.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.9.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo saṅghāṇiṃ dhāressanti, seyyathāpi gihiniyo kāmabhoginiyo”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.9.eng: “How can nuns wear hip ornaments? They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.10.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.10.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.11.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.11.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.12.eng: “How could a nun wear a hip ornament?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.13.eng: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.16.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī saṅghāṇiṃ dhāressati.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.18.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.18.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.19.1.eng: ‘If a nun wears a hip ornament, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:2.1.8.eng: if she wears it even once, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:2.2.2.eng: if she wears it because she is sick;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:2.2.5.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:2.2.6.eng: The third training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:0.4.eng: The subchapter on sunshades and sandals

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo itthālaṅkāraṃ dhārenti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.2.eng: the nuns from the group of six were wearing jewellery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo itthālaṅkāraṃ dhāressanti, seyyathāpi gihiniyo kāmabhoginiyo”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.4.eng: “How can nuns wear jewellery? They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.5.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.6.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.7.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six wear jewellery?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo itthālaṅkāraṃ dhārentī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo itthālaṅkāraṃ dhāressanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.11.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a nun wears jewellery, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:2.1.6.eng: what goes on the head, what goes around the neck, what goes on the hands, what goes on the feet, what goes around the hips.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:2.1.8.eng: if she wears it even once, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:2.2.2.eng: if she does it because she is sick;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:2.2.4.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:2.2.5.eng: The fourth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:0.5.eng: The training rule on scents and colors

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo gandhavaṇṇakena nahāyanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.2.eng: the nuns from the group of six were bathing with scents and colors.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo gandhavaṇṇakena nahāyissanti, seyyathāpi gihiniyo kāmabhoginiyo”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.4.eng: “How can nuns bathe with scents and colors? They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.5.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.6.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.7.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six bathe with scents and colors?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo gandhavaṇṇakena nahāyantī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo gandhavaṇṇakena nahāyissanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.11.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a nun bathes with scents and colors, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:2.1.10.pli: nahāyati. Payoge dukkaṭaṃ, nahānapariyosāne āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:2.1.10.eng: is bathing. For the effort there is an act of wrong conduct. At the end of the bath, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:2.2.2.eng: if she does it because she is sick;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:2.2.4.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:2.2.5.eng: The fifth training rule is finished.
